topic.title: Lectures from First Day!
topic.text:
Welcome to class

https://ufl.zoom.us/rec/share/prKhnGZwjpwJovgd74tHEYbjqa7utDIUm_y49jpkg_zlSEe-5-N7NNXlV3fB9w.QGawwIxyHK99VjZe?startTime=1737124899000 

Dr. Sounny discussed a new approach for the semester, combining remote sensing with GIS programming in a lab-like setting, and introduced a more efficient system for booking office hours. The focus was on understanding how these courses fit into the broader field of geospatial analysis and techniques. The meeting also provided an overview of the field of remote sensing and GIS programming.
Lecture on Geospatial Analysis and Tech
https://ufl.zoom.us/rec/share/prKhnGZwjpwJovgd74tHEYbjqa7utDIUm_y49jpkg_zlSEe-5-N7NNXlV3fB9w.QGawwIxyHK99VjZe?startTime=1737125172000 
The lecture discussed the history and development of Geospatial Technologies, focusing on the role of computer science and the evolution of GIS. It also explored the integration of Google Earth Engine with Esri ArcGIS, the importance of programming skills in the field, and the potential of AI in enhancing remote sensing and GIS processes. Lastly, the evolution of map-making techniques, the integration of computer science and user experience, and the potential of AI in various applications were discussed.

Some AI Tools

https://ufl.zoom.us/rec/share/prKhnGZwjpwJovgd74tHEYbjqa7utDIUm_y49jpkg_zlSEe-5-N7NNXlV3fB9w.QGawwIxyHK99VjZe?startTime=1737128366000

Dr. Sounny discussed the development and implications of various AI technologies, including notable models and chatbots, as well as the hesitance of major tech companies to introduce AI products. He explored the advantages, safety, and privacy aspects of different AI models, and highlighted the potential of AI in coding and remote sensing. Additionally, Dr. Sounny examined the performance and cost-effectiveness of various AI models and introduced the Navigator AI tool.
